javadoc:
A group of {@link LoadSpec}s (possibly from different user added sources) that have a common {@link BatchSegregatingCriteria}.

All the Apps must have the same set of {@link LoadSpec}s to be included in the same BatchGroup.

Each BatchGroup has a single selected ({@link BatchGroupLoadSpec}) that applies to all the Apps in the group.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a new BatchGroup keyed on the specified 
 BatchSegregatingCriteria.

methods.name: add

params.name: loadSpecs
params.comment: LoadSpecs to add to this group.

params.name: fsrl
params.comment: FSRL of the application's import source file.

methods.name: getSelectedBatchGroupLoadSpec
methods.comment:
Returns the selected BatchGroupLoadSpec that applies to the entire 
 BatchGroup.

return.comment: selected BatchGroupLoadSpec that applies to the entire BatchGroup.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the current {@link BatchGroupLoadSpec} for the entire group of applications.
@param selectedBatchGroupLoadSpec {@link BatchGroupLoadSpec} to set
methods.name: setSelectedBatchGroupLoadSpec
methods.comment: Sets the current BatchGroupLoadSpec for the entire group of applications.

methods.name: isEnabled
methods.comment:
Returns true if this group is 'enabled', which means that it has a selected
 BatchGroupLoadSpec and the user has chosen to mark this group as importable.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the enabled status of this group.
@param enabled boolean
methods.name: setEnabled
methods.comment: Sets the enabled status of this group.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the {@link BatchSegregatingCriteria} of this group.
@return {@link BatchSegregatingCriteria} of this group.
methods.name: getCriteria
methods.comment: Returns the BatchSegregatingCriteria of this group.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the number of applications in this group.
@return number of applications in this group.
methods.name: size
methods.comment: Returns the number of applications in this group.

return.comment: number of applications in this group.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if there are no applications in this group.
@return boolean true if there are no applications in this group.
methods.name: isEmpty
methods.comment: Returns true if there are no applications in this group.

return.comment: boolean true if there are no applications in this group.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the list of current {@link BatchLoadConfig} in this group.
@return {@link List} of {@link BatchLoadConfig} {@link BatchLoadConfig} wrappers.
methods.name: getBatchLoadConfig
methods.comment: Returns the list of current BatchLoadConfig in this group.

methods.javadoc:
Removes any applications that are inside the specified container file.
@param fsrl {@link FSRL} of a container.
methods.name: removeDescendantsOf
methods.comment: Removes any applications that are inside the specified container file.

name: BatchGroup
comment:
A group of LoadSpecs (possibly from different user added sources)
 that have a common BatchSegregatingCriteria.
 
 All the Apps must have the same set of LoadSpecs to be included in the same
 BatchGroup.
 
 Each BatchGroup has a single selected (BatchGroupLoadSpec) that applies
 to all the Apps in the group.
